title: GitHub Keepers
tldr: When information is fun to digest, do we spend more time absorbing it? Here is a list of people who write code... rendered as Keeper cards from the tabletop game of Fluxx.

title: Conway's Game Of Life
tldr: The Game of Life, also known simply as Life, is a cellular automaton devised by the British mathematician John Horton Conway in 1970. It is a zero-player game, meaning that its evolution is determined by its initial state, requiring no further input. One interacts with the Game of Life by creating an initial configuration and observing how it evolves. It is Turing complete and can simulate a universal constructor or any other Turing machine. This rendition was written in vanilla ReactJS during a CS build week at Lambda School.

title: Chuck Norris
tldr: GNOME is a desktop environment for Unix-like operating systems. GNOME Shell is the defining technology of the GNOME 3 user experience; An experience that would restrain my propensity for switching desktop environments. The GNU/GNOME Shell is written in C and Javascript and can be extended to provide a more customized experience... This extension will fetch a Chuck Norris joke, on demand, from the Internet Chuck Norris Database.

title: Replate (backend)
tldr: Replate was designed to facilitate the reduction of food-waste by connecting those who are in need of food with those who have more than enough to share. This RESTful API was conceived in a modular fashion, designed to be further extended when/where appropriate.

title: Tets
tldr: Before enrolling in Lambda School I wrote a Tetris-clone in Python with Pygame. I then ported the engine to Kivy for Android compatibility. Soon after that, I found the Godot engine and I just couldn't resist porting it one more time to enable cross-compilation at the click of a button. The source to each port is linked in the README. I suggest you lower the volume when trying the WASM app. It hasn't exactly been polished...yet.
